attributes.action: Organise parade in London for TeamGB and ParalympicsGB following 2016 Rio Games
attributes.background: TeamGB is doing a breathtaking job in Rio and ParalympicsGB will do just the same.  This is a wonderful, breathtaking achievement and something everyone in the UK can take pride in.  We should show our appreciation as a nation by holding a homecoming parade like we did in 2012.

attributes.action: Spend £6m of foreign aid so 40 or Paralympics teams can attend Rio2016
attributes.background: There are around 40 countries that are unable to attend the Paralympics in Rio because of a funding shortfall. As well as being a good thing to do, it would show GB in a good light.  https://www.theguardian.com/sport/2016/aug/14/paralympic-committee-to-hold-budget-crisis-talks-with-brazil

attributes.action: Cancel BoE‘s cash injection to the financial sector, replace it with People's QE
attributes.background: The Bank of England’s planned cash injection to financial services will inflate asset prices, discourage saving and increase inequality. Government should instruct the Bank to implement a programme of People's Quantitative Easing instead to stimulate private spending and reduce UK household debt.
attributes.additional_details: Economists internationally have criticised the Bank’s decision, as it fails to address the greater risk to our economy: businesses and households cutting spending in the wake of increasing economic uncertainty. The BoE’s £375 billion programme of QE has damaged the UK economy since 2009 by inflating asset prices. These policies discourage saving and make it difficult for ordinary people to live, further increasing inequality and resulting suffering and anger that is corrosive to our society.

attributes.action: Property Council Tax Must be Fair on the Amount of Bedrooms, Not as Now ?
attributes.background: At this time people pay the same amount from a Two Bed to a Six, this is unfair as a Two Bed does Not Create the same Waste as a Three/Four/Five or Six plus, many properties do extensions adding extra Bedrooms without the Councils knowing, Loft Bedrooms added, Brick Sheds made into a Bedroom etc.
attributes.additional_details:
A single person living on their own should Not have to pay the same as a Family of Five Six or More, it is a Loophole and unfair, the Law needs updating as when Rooms are added the Council Must be informed and their Council Tax increased as Appropriate and makes the system fair for All, should be Equal Rights.

Have got a complete list for a road which everyone pays the same from a Two Bed to a Six Bed, very wrong, let's have it fair.

attributes.action: Increase the Carer's Allowance to £80 per week, from £62.10 per week
attributes.background: There are an estimated 6.5 million carers in the UK, meaning that 1 in 10 people have caring duties. Unpaid carers save the UK government £119 billion per year, more than is spent on the NHS. To receive the carers allowance, you must care for 35 hours a week, when many care for 100 hours or more.
attributes.additional_details: Working up to 100 hours, the Carer's Allowance equates to 62p per hour, in contrast to the minimum wage of £7.20 per hour. The burden of caring is great, with 625,000 carers suffering from mental or physical illnesses - around the population of Glasgow. The problem will only get worse with 6,000 people becoming carers every day - these people need help now.

attributes.action: Abolish A2 motorcycle licence and become fully un-restricted after 2 years
attributes.background: Back in 2013 the UK Government changed the laws on motorcycle licence having to take additional tests after being restricted for 2 years and having to fork out more money for for another mod1 and mod2 when it should go back to how it used to be and full unrestricted after 2 years automatically
attributes.additional_details:
16 cbt - 50 cc
17 cbt - 125cx now allowing 250 cc on L plates 
19 restricted licence 
21 derestricted license 
24 and above complete a direct access 

Remove the need for additional tests once passed restricted licence stay restricted for 2 years then automatically upgrade to full derestricted licence

attributes.action: GET WAITING TIMES OF DRIVING TESTS DOWN TO WITHIN 3 WEEKS
attributes.background: WAITING TIMES FOR DRIVING TESTS AROUND THE COUNTRY ARE GETTING LONGER AT THE MOMENT IT CAN BE AS LONG AS 3 MONTHS, THIS IS CAUSING SEVERE PROBLEMS TO PUPILS AND DRIVING INSTRUCTORS . ALSO TESTS ARE BEING CANCELLED  IN THE WAITING ROOM AND THE PUPILS ARE NOT GETTING THE REQUIRED NOTICE .
attributes.additional_details: IN MY AREA OF WORK THE EARLIEST DRIVING TEST APPOINTMENT IS 1ST NOV  THE DATE TODAY  IS 20TH JULY I WOULD CHALLENGE ANYONE IN THE COUNTRY TO FORECAST 3 MONTHS IN ADVANCE WEATHER A PUPIL WILL BE READY FOR THERE DRIVING TEST .THIS WAITING TIME IS NOT CAUSING JUST EXTRA PRESSURE ON A PUPIL TO PASS 1ST TIME BUT ALSO CAUSING THE DRIVING INSTRUCTOR EXTRA PRESSURE AND MAKING US LOOK LIKE COMPLETE IDIOTS. THE DVSA GET PAID FOR A SERVICE THEY ARE NOT PROVIDING CAUSING UNDUE STRESS AND PROBLEMS

attributes.action: Make Counselling and Psychotherapy a professional qualification.
attributes.background:
Anyone is able to set up in private practice and call themselves a Counsellor or Psychotherapist.
I would like a minimum qualification that is recognised by a regulatory body, such as the BACP, to benchmark a qualification to prevent poorly trained or unqualified individuals from practising.

attributes.action: Change the law for drink driving limit to zero and an instant ban
attributes.background:
Far to many innocent people are killed every year by drink drivers. 
It's time a stop is put to it by ways of zero tolerance and instant bans being handed out for any who fail a road side breath test.

attributes.action: Change the conveyancing process in England to make buying & selling more secure.
attributes.background: I have been working in the property industry since 2000 and now own my own Estate Agency firm. Over the last 16 years I have seen thousands of people who have been messed around by buyers and sellers alike. This has resulted in heartache, stress and the loss of substantial amounts of money.
attributes.additional_details: On average over 30% of sales fall through each year in England, the knock on effect of this can ruin people’s lives. Almost every country around the world other than England dictates that both, buyers and sellers have to pay a NON refundable deposit to secure the property. If either party withdraw the deposit is forfeited. In England a buyer or seller can pull out up to the day of exchange. One thoughtless person can ruin people’s lives with no consequence. Let's put a stop to it.

attributes.action: Ask for 'EU Membership for Individuals', when negotiating leaving EU.
attributes.background: Education
attributes.additional_details:
A choice for individuals who wish 'To travel/study/work ' for £4:50 week or any other amount deemed reasonable.
It excludes public health and benefits, if no reciprocal arrangement by the EU, since the main cause of  Brexit was the magnetic state benefits package, allowed by the UK.
This is not designed to encourage mass migration, but to allow individuals to persue visa free travel, and to study and work to broaden their horizons, learn languages and foster good relations.

attributes.action: Abolish extra charges for holidays during school holidays for single travellers
attributes.background: Stop or limit the travel compainies charging a premiuim on holidays for people travelling without children during term breaks.
attributes.additional_details: As a single person who travels alone or with friends its unfair that we have to pay extra for a holiday if its during a school break. This also limits the amount of time we can take off work lossing around 8 weeks per year. A holiday for example to spain costs around £150-£250 more at such times. If like myself due to your work (healthcare) you cant take time off during half of November, all of December and half of January because of school break costs it limits exactly what you can have.

attributes.action: Give voters more powers to unseat an MP who is not representing their interests
attributes.background: In the EU referendum, many constituents felt let down by their local MP, after showing support for the opposing view. In some instances it was abundantly clear the MP was completely at odds with their constituency, e.g. Kate Hoey. In such cases, we should be able to request a vote to unseat the MP.
attributes.additional_details: The Borough of Lambeth voted overwhelmingly in favour of remaining in the EU, with 79%, the highest in the England. The MP for Vauxhall Kate Hoey, campaigned for the UK to leave, which demonstrates that she no longer represents the interests of the majority of her constituents. This poses the question of whether she should remain in her seat or give her constituents the power to vote for a new MP.

attributes.action: Highlight the serious issue of mental health as a top Government priority.
attributes.background:
We believe that the Government should prioritise the issue of mental health as a priority.
The issue of mental health affects many families including both adults and children.
We feel that the time has come for Government to be more proactive in addressing this very serious area.

attributes.action: Rights to vote for all migrants who have resided in the UK for the past 5 years.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to extend the right to vote for the EU referendum to the migrants that have lived and worked in the UK for the past 5 years. We call a second referendum open to this minority that has not been included in the vote but that will be directly affected by it.

attributes.action: Hold independence referendums for London, Scotland, and Northern Ireland
attributes.background: The people of London, Scotland, and Northern Ireland are at risk of being taken out of the EU, despite voting heavily to remain. If Scotland is granted a 2nd independence referendum as a result of this, then the same choice should be granted to both London and Northern Ireland.
attributes.additional_details:
EU referendum results as reported by the BBC:

London: "Across all 33 boroughs in the capital, 59.9% (2.26 million) voted in favour of remaining in the EU. In some areas, the remain vote was more than 70%."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36612916

Scotland: "Scotland has voted in favour of the UK staying in the EU by 62% to 38% - with all 32 council areas backing Remain."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-scotland-politics-36599102

Northern Ireland: "Northern Ireland has voted to remain in the EU Referendum by a majority of 56% to 44%."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-northern-ireland-36614443

attributes.action: Citizens must pass GCSE level maths and English to vote
attributes.background: Citizens under the age of 18 are unable to vote due to not being mature enough to understand implications of elections and referendums. However, maturity should not be determined by age.
attributes.additional_details:
Passing basic mathematical and English competency tests will ensure voters are able to better make informed choices, and understand the implications and consequences of their voting choice. 

Very often voters are misinformed, and unable to distinguish fact from fiction due to their lack of education. It should therefore go without saying that not being able to understand basic maths and English should also correlate with poor understanding of elections and referendums.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate the misleading information by the EU Leave Campaign
attributes.background:
The nation's decision on Europe must be based wholly upon an informed choice and not upon misleading campaigns of false information provided by the Leave Campaign.
We ask such debate to take place in Parliament before any debate enacting Article 50 or any vote on it.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/16/nigel-farage-defends-ukip-breaking-point-poster-queue-of-migrants
http://m.huffpost.com/uk/entry/uk_576e2967e4b08d2c56393241?edition=uk 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36353013
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6H8TA631ou0 and http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/eu-referendum-result-nigel-farage-nhs-pledge-disowns-350-million-pounds-a7099906.html
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/3-brexit-promises-campaigners-wriggled-8271762 and 
http://qz.com/715877/the-backtracking-on-promises-by-brexit-campaigners-has-already-begun/

attributes.action: Formal identification required to sign petitions for Parliament to consider.
attributes.background: The Petitions sign on procedure to be changed to that like 'passenger information checks' on aircraft, in so far as formal identification be required for the petition to be accepted. UK Passport, or similar identification that proves the signatory is eligible, and to prevent fraud.
attributes.additional_details:
We have seen petitions are being fraudulently signed by people from all over the world on UK petitions, in particular in reference to the request for another referendum.

Anyone signing a petition MUST be legally eligible to do so, and the current system is being abused extensively and illegally. Having a formal system in place would not only prevent fraud, but where fraud does occur would offer the opportunity to take legal action against those concerned and maintain democracy.

attributes.action: add units to all special needs schools for children with advanced complex needs
attributes.background: My son Ashton 9 has severe autism severe learning difficulties PDA non verbal at times challenging behaviour.Has been told his special needs school can't cater to his needs the setting isn't right after 6 years that he needs a specialist unit and has to leave BUT there are no units in my region
attributes.additional_details: After been told Ashton has to leave his special needs school after 6 years of been there that the setting is not right And he needs a specialist unit at which I'm appalled can happen to a child after 6 years of routine and relationship building with staff how can this happen ..there's no units the nearest is 2 hours away with a ridicolous waiting list or I can send him to boarding unit miles away mon -fri which is not a option we'd be heartbroken as would he my only option is to home school now

attributes.action: The UK should join EFTA and should stay out of the EEA and Schengen.
attributes.background: So we can maintain free trade with European countries whilst maintaining our borders outside of the EU

attributes.action: Ensure participation in EU free trade, science, security, & environment programs
attributes.background: Now we have voted to leave the EU we must ensure that we will keep access to as many of the EU structures and programs that have been so beneficial to the UK over the years. We ask the government to negotiate access to these programs including free trade, science, security, & environment programs

attributes.action: Hold a new EU referendum if there is a major shift in public opinion.
attributes.background: The consequences of leave have, until now, been pure speculation.  They are now facts and becoming clear: a fall in the pound, threatened major job losses, the break up of the UK.  Had these consequences been clear before the vote, the public may have voted differently and should confirm the vote.

attributes.action: make no cuts to Access To Work at the DWP.
attributes.background: Access to work is the only way to  help employers to employ  disabled people.  It must not be cut.
attributes.additional_details: My name is David wilkins and I am a totally blind and partially deaf Freelance Journalist.

attributes.action: Trans issues should be taught as part of Personal, Social and Health Education
attributes.background: Trans issues should be taught as part of Personal, Social and Health Education. Also, Gender-variant young people should get sufficient support at school. Schools need to understand their responsibilities under the Equality Act 2010 and must ensure all staff receive training.
attributes.additional_details: The House of Commons Women and Equalities Committee published a report in January 2016 with regards to Transgender Equality. Within this report it was established that more needs to be done to ensure that gender-variant young people receive support in school. the Equality and Human Rights Commission stated that research shows that 91% of trans boys and 66% of trans girls experience harassment or bullying at school, leading to depression, isolation and the desire to leave education.

attributes.action: Give EU nationals living in the UK for 4 years or more automatic citizenship now
attributes.background:
We are asking parliament give citizenship to EU migrants living in the UK for more than 4 years to:

- prevent the loss of skilled workers
- honour year long contributions into the system 
- give re-assurance to over 3m EU migrants 
- make sure in future all views are represented and respected
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is not meant to be exclusive. Non-EU migrants have a clear set of defined rules however hence our friends are covered already and know where the road gores - WE DO NOT and need answers now from a country that has left us hanging. We represent almost 5% of the UK pubic - yet have no voice. 
4 years are based on the decisions made in the re-negotiations between the UK and the EU commission in Feb 2016. This petition follows the same rational (4 years entitle to benefits for example)

attributes.action: Match the money and resources currently invested in Cornwall by the EU.
attributes.background:
As part of the EU Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly benefited from The Cornwall and Isles of Scilly Growth Programme. This is currently worth €603,706,864 of EU funding.

The government must match the value of this funding after leaving the EU and ensure the continuation of its current projects.
attributes.additional_details:
Please refer to:
http://www.erdfconvergence.org.uk/growth-programme

attributes.action: Set up an inquiry into the impact of press reporting on the Brexit vote
attributes.background: A referendum such as on Brexit relies on informed decision making by the public. It is understandable that each side will represent their position in the best light possible. But we need to understand if any persons manipulated public opinion through press reporting beyond the legally acceptable.
attributes.additional_details: Just like the Chilcot inquiry into the Iraq war and the potential manipulation of public opinion through the media, we need a similar inquiry about whether any actors had vested interest in a Brexit and if so, whether they did take any steps to manipulate public opinion in an unacceptable, illegal manner by impacting press reporting on Brexit.

attributes.action: Increase public spending by £350 million per week as the Leave campaign promised
attributes.background: Government to increase direct spending on public services by £350,000,000 per week in real terms by the end of 2018, without increasing taxes, as the Brexit Leave campaign promised.

attributes.action: Allow 17 year olds to vote in future referendums and general elections.
attributes.background: Young people in college are not allowed to vote (if they're under 18) which is extremely unfair as it is our own future. It is ridiculous that those who are 65+ have such a say in our future. Ot is undemocratic that we have no say in our future, and it needs to stop. 17 year olds deserve the vote.

attributes.action: Petition for London and the South East to breakaway from the UK
attributes.background: After the Brexit vote, London clearly has a different stance on the future to the rest of the country. London also has a vastly different economy to the rest of the country so breaking away makes sesne
attributes.additional_details:
Regional Brexit vote split

http://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/2016-brexit-referendum/

attributes.action: Government fund Boot Camps for teenagers instead of children's homes and units
attributes.background: More and more children and teenagers become worse off after being referred to care homes and units. The reason being is that they end up establishing new relationships with others who have considerably worse issues. The result of this can have a severe negative impact rather than help the situation.
attributes.additional_details: We want to prevent children and teenagers from enduring this type of situation. They also regularly go missing from homes resulting in more police resources. Police have confirmed that missing children is a regularity which is often a waste of police time. If we were to introduce teenage bootcamps it would prevent a lot of future crime and saving expenses on services such as police, social work, alcohol addiction, drug rehabilitation, psychologists, prison sentences, teenage pregnancies and more

attributes.action: A motion of no confidence be brought against this government.
attributes.background: A motion of no confidence be brought against this government for misleading and lying to the general public over Britex.
attributes.additional_details: Half of the government say that the other half is not telling the truth, so it must be true that at least one half is not telling the truth according to our own elected representatives

attributes.action: Don't scrap A level/GCSE Electronics/Systems and control. Help future engineers.
attributes.background: Scrapping these subjects will cause a fall in the amount of students leaving school with any design or electronics experience or knowledge. We should be encouraging students to become enginneers to continue advancements in technology for the future, instead this opportunity is being taken from them.
attributes.additional_details: Gonernment changes to A levels and GCSEs are moving more towards pure academia and although physics and maths are critical in technology and electronics, to be successful in the industry you must still know how to design, how a circuit works, about microchips etc. The things you are not taught in physics. Without these subjects, less people will be inspired to make their own projects and those who are inspired will be ill equipped to do so and will struggle at degree level with no experience.

attributes.action: A referendum to Vote Scotland out of the U.K.
attributes.background: Scotland had their Referendum to be independent. The SNP want to Remain in the EU against the will of English and Welsh voters. Therefore I believe England, Wales and Northern Ireland should get the chance to have their Referendum to vote Scotland out of the U.K.

attributes.action: Change the law on Minimum Requirements for Riding a Motorcycle
attributes.background: I do not need to write a massive amount of issues here, but however when you see young teens on motorcycles riding in shorts and t-shirts, you think something should be done! at the moment the Law ONLY requires you to wear a helmet, I think basic  jeans and jackets should be Law as well as a helmet.

attributes.action: The government to put political pressure on the US to impose gun restrictions.
attributes.background: It is embarrassing for our nation to be in a close relationship with a country that refuses to put the safety of its citizens first. Today yet another mass shooting has taken place and over 50 members of the LGBT community have died. We can not support any government that allows this to happen.

attributes.action: When a minor offence becomes 'spent', remove it from a person's enhanced DBS.
attributes.background: When I was young, I got into trouble with the police which resulted in a criminal record; these were minor offences. All my convictions are now spent but they still show up on an enhanced DBS check which makes it difficult to find alternative employment.We shouldn't be judged by juvenile mistakes.
attributes.additional_details: After a search online, it became apparent that this issue is common. There are many skilled and qualified people who are more than capable of doing there job but employers won't take the risk because of a document which states information from 5, 10, 15 even 30 years ago.

attributes.action: Mindfulness Meditation on the Curriculum
attributes.background: Add mindfulness meditation to the school curriculum to tackle the issues of stress, anxiety and poor concentration amongst young people.
attributes.additional_details: The Science Behind Mindfulness Meditation: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wP9731bDJlE

attributes.action: If Asia Bibi is executed we should 'cease trading' with Pakistan immediately.
attributes.background: Asia Bibi, a Christian, offered water to a Muslim woman. She refused as it had been handled by a 'dirty animal and dirty Christian'. She was found guilty of blasphemy and sentenced to death because she said 'Jesus may have a different viewpoint to Mohammed'.
attributes.additional_details: Daily Express 1 June 2016. Asia Bibi offered water to a Muslim woman who “I said ‘I think Jesus would have a different viewpoint to Mohammed’, the woman said ‘how dare you question the prophet, dirty animal’ and a 'dirty Christian'. She was found guilty by a Pakistan court of blasphemy and sentenced to death.This, by inference, is saying all Christians including our Queen as Head of Commonwealth and also Church of England is also. STOP trading, giving AID and eject from Commonwealth.

attributes.action: Free dental & optical treatment inc free glasses for diabetics.
attributes.background: Myself and other people who suffer from diabetes know the complications we suffer with our dental and eyesight problems, Causing very uncomfortable pain and strain. We are constantly paying huge bills to our dentists and opticians on a regular Basis for treatment we need, that we cannot prevent.
attributes.additional_details:
Diabetes is the leading cause of blindness in adults aged 20 to 74. High blood sugar which cannot always be prevented causes the lens of the eye to swell, which changes our ability to see.
Gum disease is much more common In a person who suffers from diabetes, this is because the red blood cells cannot fight infection as well as a non sufferer, causing pain and in time, brittle teeth. This in turn forces us to visit the dentist a lot more often than the average person.

attributes.action: Ban "haul route" traffic lights on the A21 between Tunbridge Wells and Tonbridge
attributes.background: Anyone who uses the A21 between Tonbridge and Tunbridge Wells knows that the road works to widen it are essential. However the "haul route" traffic light system is not, especially in rush hour times. The undersigned feel that the use of these temporary traffic lights should be banned in rush hour.
attributes.additional_details: With these traffic lights in place a journey that normally takes 20 minutes can sometimes take over an hour. The constant cuing that results from these lights causes inconvenience, lateness, and in some cases car crashes. We feel that traffic conditions caused by these lights are dangerous and that having to get up almost an hour earlier for work/school (especially in the fast exam season), or getting home unessasarily late is unreasonable.

attributes.action: Introduce a rule to prevent the trading of insults and irrelevant remarks at PMQ
attributes.background: The Prime Minister as an elected public official and head of the UK government, responsible for the policy and decisions of the government should not be using PMQ as an opportunity to trade insults and to make irrelevant remarks that do not relate to questions posed.
attributes.additional_details: In recent months responses, quality of debate and the PM's behaviour at PMQ has reached a level that is now unacceptable, as it condones behaviour that would not be accepted in other spheres of society or workplace. The House of Parliament is a working environment, in which MPs of all parties are paid by UK tax payers to govern and formulate policies to benefit society, therefore it is right and proper that questions asked at PMQ are answered in a respectful manner.

attributes.action: Standardise Breastfeeding Advice & Support
attributes.background: Breastfeeding can be hard to establish without correct support or advice. Many mothers turn to formula and regret not being able to breastfeed. I found it incredibly confusing, being given conflicting advice from one midwife to the next, and found it daughting when I went home from hospital.
attributes.additional_details: You may have heard the saying: Breast is Best, but in the UK we have a considerably low number of breastfeeding mothers compared to other European countries. A lot of mothers turn to formula through lack of support or advice. So this petition is aimed at standardising the support and advice given. We need a better structure in place to help breastfeeding mothers to establish, maintain and continue breastfeeding for as long as they wish to nurse their baby/toddler.

attributes.action: Make June 15th (signing of the Magna Carta) a bank holiday
attributes.background: Magna Carta is the foundation of our country. It is the beginning of our parliament, the oldest parliament in the world, and the origins of how we view society. So far the only memorial to it was made by the Americans who understand its importance and we should notice the Magna Carta's importance.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magna_Carta
Wiki page for the Magna Carta

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4qj2vpp9Wf4
UK parliament YouTube Page with a video on the document itself

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KhVnHQVbtB8
Daniel Hannan MEP's speech on the 800th anniversary of Magna Carta - speaking at Runnymede

attributes.action: MPs and council leaders should cease second occupations until they leave office.
attributes.background: To prevent conflict of interest in the political arena, any person representing the PEOPLE should cease any activities that produce a second income.
attributes.additional_details: When persons are employed by the public purse they should put 100% of their effort into their job. It is known that some tenders for works within the public sector have directly and indirectly benefited State employed individuals. This is morally wrong and adds to the current lack of trust the Public have in our Government and Councils.

attributes.action: Open a public inquiry into privately contracted benefit assessments by the DWP
attributes.background: Channel 4 Dispatches has revealed a systematic agenda to cut benefit payments by Capita, contracted for the DWP for Personal Independence Payment assessments alongside Atos. There is evidence to suggest systematic fraud and abuse of vulnerable adults by these companies. We call for a public inquiry.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.channel4.com/info/press/news/the-great-benefits-row-channel-4-dispatches

attributes.action: Plug The Loophole and Stop Cash in Hand paying No Tax, Unfair for Others Who Do
attributes.background:
The Inland Revenue must lose a great deal with Many people dealing in Cash in Hand with No Tax being Paid, Everyone Must give Invoices with Full details on them and Reciept given in every Transaction.

At this time there are far to many who Flout the System while Paye can Not, not a Level System.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people working on a self employed basis Rip the system off, make a lot of money as a Great deal does not go through the so Called books and is a Fraud but they get away with it due to the System, many Millions are Lost, there are many such areas one being Fast Food along the roads where only some goes through the books,

Others are Scrap and Rubbish around the Roads, house Clearance to name a few.

Trust this will be looked into with these issues in the Limelight.

attributes.action: Wood burning stoves should require a licence and regulated for nuisance.
attributes.background: Wood stoves create smoke and fumes that are unpleasant and dangerous to health. The government see these devices as cheap energy. Smoke and fumes produce particulates as harmful to health as diesels or secondary cigarette smoke. This fashion accessory is dangerous not romantic.
attributes.additional_details:
Building regulations are in force to ensure construction is safe, the clean air act is there to make the air we breath as safe as possible,  Environmental Health officers are there to prevent nuisance. 
Building control ignore there own rules and do not take notice of wind effect on the way smoke and fumes enter homes, Environmental Health are reluctant to make a nuisance case because the government policy is to support them, the clean air act is ignored. You cannot keep smoke and fumes out of your home and those with a duty of care ignore the risks. Even DEFRA do not know the full risks in there support of wood burning. Once installed of course anything is burnt. They need regulating and licencing.

attributes.action: Make sexism a hate crime across the UK and in all institutions
attributes.background: Sexism is not yet legally a hate crime which is making court cases difficult due to no specific law dictating what counts as sexist abuse. Nottingham is already attempting to make it a hate crime but this will not be effective until it is on a big scale.
